headline: Democrat running for Arizona governor proposes free pre-K
author: Associated Press
sentences: He also says his plan would eventually serve 60,000 children at a cost of $450 million a year and boost the economy by allowing more parents to enter the workforce or save money on child care.
Former state Rep. Aaron Lieberman outlined the proposal in a Thursday news conference at an eastern Phoenix Head Start center.
PHOENIX (AP) â€” A Democrat running for Arizona governor says all 4-year-olds should have the option for free preschool.
Lieberman faces Secretary of State Katie Hobbs and businessman Marco Lopez in the Democratic primary in August.
He says high-quality early learning programs set children up for success.
